body_html: @alquraishi I'd like to ask a question if I may. In your example, the batch size is 4(static), and num_stepss also is a static vector with length 4. But if I have another batch with different num_stepss [14, 30, 24, 17] (Which I mean every batch has different num_stepss...), how could I use the dynamic_rnn model?
body_text: @alquraishi I'd like to ask a question if I may. In your example, the batch size is 4(static), and num_stepss also is a static vector with length 4. But if I have another batch with different num_stepss [14, 30, 24, 17] (Which I mean every batch has different num_stepss...), how could I use the dynamic_rnn model?
body: @alquraishi I'd like to ask a question if I may. In your example, the **batch size** is 4(static), and **num_stepss** also is a static vector with length 4. But if I have another batch with different **num_stepss** [14, 30, 24, 17] (Which I mean every batch has different num_stepss...), how could I use the dynamic_rnn model?
